intro: Thyrsanthema ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has silver-gray foliage covered in fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged periods of drought. Thyrsanthema ehrenbergii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
